content: "There's one thing worse than change and that's the status quo." -- John le Carré, RIP
renderedContent: "There's one thing worse than change and that's the status quo." -- John le Carré, RIP

content: "You do what you can for as long as you can, and when you finally can't, you do the next best thing. You back up but you don't give up." -- Chuck Yeager, RIP
renderedContent: "You do what you can for as long as you can, and when you finally can't, you do the next best thing. You back up but you don't give up." -- Chuck Yeager, RIP

content: “Prior to capitalism, the way people amassed great wealth was by looting, plundering and enslaving their fellow man. Capitalism made it possible to become wealthy by serving your fellow man.” — Walter Williams, RIP
renderedContent: “Prior to capitalism, the way people amassed great wealth was by looting, plundering and enslaving their fellow man. Capitalism made it possible to become wealthy by serving your fellow man.” — Walter Williams, RIP

content: "No matter what your past has been, you have a spotless future." -- Tony Hsieh, RIP
renderedContent: "No matter what your past has been, you have a spotless future." -- Tony Hsieh, RIP

content: "You want to get Capone? Here's how you get him. He pulls a knife, you pull a gun. He sends one of yours to the hospital, you send one of his to the morgue! That's the Chicago way." --Sean Connery, RIP
renderedContent: "You want to get Capone? Here's how you get him. He pulls a knife, you pull a gun. He sends one of yours to the hospital, you send one of his to the morgue! That's the Chicago way." --Sean Connery, RIP

content: "There's a plaque on our wall that says we've sold over 65 million albums, and I don't feel I've accomplished anything. I feel like I'm just getting started." -- Eddie Van Halen, RIP
renderedContent: "There's a plaque on our wall that says we've sold over 65 million albums, and I don't feel I've accomplished anything. I feel like I'm just getting started." -- Eddie Van Halen, RIP

content: "I would like to be remembered as someone who used whatever talent she had to do her work to the very best of her ability." -- Ruth Bader Ginsburg, RIP
renderedContent: "I would like to be remembered as someone who used whatever talent she had to do her work to the very best of her ability." -- Ruth Bader Ginsburg, RIP
